table.name: dependency_conditions
table.remarks: (Enum) Types of conditions that can control whether or not a variable is presented to the user.

table.name: document_saved_versions
table.remarks: Saved versions of document variable values. A saved version is conceptually just a reference to a particular point in the edit history of the document; to restore that version, we ignore any later edits.

table.name: document_statuses
table.remarks: (Enum) Current stage of a document's lifecycle.

table.name: document_templates
table.remarks: Templates for the different types of documents this system can produce.

table.name: documents
table.remarks: Top-level information about documents.

table.name: variable_image_values
table.remarks: Linking table that defines which image files are values of which variables.

table.name: variable_injection_display_styles
table.remarks: (Enum) For injected variables, whether to render them as text fragments that are suitable for including in paragraphs or as separate items on the page. Analogous to the inline/block display styles in CSS. Not applicable to all variable types.

table.name: variable_link_values
table.remarks: Type-specific details of the values of link variables.

table.name: variable_manifest_entries
table.remarks: Linking table that defines which variables appear in which manifests and in what order.

table.name: variable_manifests
table.remarks: A collection of the definitions of the variables for a document template. This is how we do versioning of variable definitions. Each revision of the variable definitions is represented as a new manifest.

table.name: variable_numbers
table.remarks: Information about number variables that is not relevant for other variable types.

table.name: variable_owners
table.remarks: Which internal users are responsible for reviewing the values of which variables for which projects.

table.name: variable_section_default_values
table.remarks: Section values that are set by default on newly-created documents.

checkConstraint.constraint: ((text_value IS NOT NULL) OR (used_variable_id IS NOT NULL))
checkConstraint.name: must_have_text_or_reference

table.name: variable_section_recommendations
table.remarks: Which sections recommend using which other variables. Can vary between manifests.

table.name: variable_section_values
table.remarks: Fragments of the contents of document sections. Each fragment is either a block of text or a usage of a variable; they are assembled in order to render the contents of the section.

checkConstraint.constraint: ((text_value IS NOT NULL) OR (used_variable_id IS NOT NULL))
checkConstraint.name: must_have_text_or_reference

table.name: variable_sections
table.remarks: Hierarchy of sections that define the structure of the rendered document.

column.name: render_heading
column.remarks: If false, the title is not included in the rendered document. False in cases where we want a single section to have multiple content blocks; in that case, we add them as child sections with this flag set to false.

table.name: variable_select_option_values
table.remarks: The options of a select variable that are selected in a document. Options that are not selected do not appear in this table.

table.name: variable_select_options
table.remarks: Available options for select variables.

column.name: rendered_text
column.remarks: What text should be rendered in the document when this option is selected. Null if the option's name should be rendered.

table.name: variable_selects
table.remarks: Information about select variables that is not relevant for other variable types. This table only has information about the variable as a whole; the options are in `variable_select_options`.

column.name: is_multiple
column.remarks: If true, allow multiple options to be selected. The list of selected options is considered a single value; do not set `variables.is_list` to true unless you want a list of multiple-select variables.

table.name: variable_table_columns
table.remarks: The order of the columns in a table. Each column must be a variable whose parent is the table.

table.name: variable_table_styles
table.remarks: (Enum) How a table should be rendered visually in the document.

table.name: variable_tables
table.remarks: Information about tables that is not relevant for other variable types.

table.name: variable_text_types
table.remarks: (Enum) Types of text stored in a text variable field.

table.name: variable_texts
table.remarks: Information about text variables that is not relevant for other variable types.

table.name: variable_types
table.remarks: (Enum) Data types that can be assigned to variables.

table.name: variable_usage_types
table.remarks: (Enum) When a variable is used in a section, whether to inject the value of the variable or the location where the value is injected elsewhere in the doc.

table.name: variable_value_table_rows
table.remarks: Linking table that defines which variable values are in which rows of a table.

table.name: variable_values
table.remarks: Insert-only table with all historical and current values of all inputs.

column.name: text_value
column.remarks: For text or email variables, the variable's value. May contain newlines if the text variable is multi-line.

table.name: variable_workflow_history
table.remarks: History of changes to the workflow details for a variable in a project. This table is append-only; edits to the values are represented as new rows, and the row with the highest ID for a given project and variable ID holds the current workflow details for that variable.

column.name: max_variable_value_id
column.remarks: The highest variable value ID at the time the workflow operation happened. This is to support fetching the variable value as it existed at the time of the workflow operation. This ID is not required to be a value of the variable referenced by `variable_id` (it can be the maximum value ID for the project as a whole).

table.name: variable_workflow_statuses
table.remarks: (Enum) Workflow statuses of variables in projects. The list of valid statuses depends on the variable type.

table.name: variables
table.remarks: variables that can be supplied by the user. This table stores the variables themselves, not the values of the variables in a particular document. Type-specific information is in child tables such as `variable_numbers`.

column.name: replaces_variable_id
column.remarks: If this is a new version of a variable that existed in a previous manifest version, the ID of the previous version of the variable. This allows the system to automatically migrate values from older variable versions when a document is updated to a new manifest version.

column.name: is_list
column.remarks: True if this variable is a list of values rather than a single value. If the variable is a table, true if the table can contain multiple rows.

routine.name: reject_delete()
reject_delete_value()
routine.comment: Trigger function that rejects deletion of `variable_values` rows unless the entire document is being deleted.

routine.name: reject_delete_value_child()
reject_update()
reject_update_value()
